example.en: Mom: Be careful! Dad: Let him try, he'll be fine.
example.cn: 妈妈：小心！爸爸：让他试试，他会没事的。

gram.constraints: 是塑造人物和展示家庭动态的有效方式。

paras.en: Dad and I jogged down the stoop stairs and headed down the block. "Call me after school before you get on the subway!" Mom yelled at me from the window. I didn't even turn around but waved my hand at her so she'd know I heard her. Dad did turn around, walking backward for a few steps. "War and Peace, Isabel!" he called out, smiling as he pointed at me. "War and Peace!"
paras.cn: 爸爸和我慢跑下门廊的台阶，沿着街区走去。“放学后上地铁前给我打电话！” 妈妈从窗口对我喊道。我甚至没转身，只是对她挥了挥手，好让她知道我听到了。爸爸确实转过身，倒着走了几步。“《战争与和平》，伊莎贝尔！” 他喊道，一边指着我一边微笑。“《战争与和平》！”

vocab.ex: He jogged down the hill to warm up for his run.
They sat on the stoop, watching the people walk by.
Let's head down the block to the new cafe.
The coach had to yell at the players to get their attention.
It's tricky to walk backward without tripping.
He had to call out her name twice before she heard him.

gram.name: 象征性重复（用于强化观点）
gram.pattern: Repeating a key phrase to reinforce an earlier argument.
gram.function: 父亲通过重复喊出“《战争与和平》！”这个短语，不仅是在和妻子开玩笑，更是在重申他之前的论点。这个书名在此处成了一个象征，代表着女儿的成熟、独立和足以应对世界的能力。这是一种用象征性语言来结束争论并表达支持的巧妙方式。

example.en: As she left for her solo trip, her father simply smiled and said, 'The eagle has left the nest.'
example.cn: 当她离开去独自旅行时，她的父亲只是微笑着说：‘雏鹰已离巢。’

gram.constraints: 是一种富有层次感的、通过象征来传达信息的修辞手法。

paras.en: Both sides of Dad's family were Jews from Russia and Poland. Poppa's grandparents fled the pogroms and ended up in NYC at the turn of the century. Tata's parents fled the Nazis and ended up in Argentina in the forties. Poppa and Tata met at a dance on the Lower East Side while she was in town visiting a cousin. They got married, moved to Bayside, and had Dad and Uncle Ben.
paras.cn: 爸爸家的两边都是来自俄罗斯和波兰的犹太人。波帕的祖父母为躲避大屠杀而逃离，在世纪之交时最终定居在纽约市。塔塔的父母为躲避纳粹而逃离，在四十年代最终定居在阿根廷。波帕和塔塔是在下东区的一场舞会上相遇的，当时她正在城里拜访一位堂兄。他们结了婚，搬到了贝赛德，然后生了爸爸和本叔叔。

vocab.ex: Many people were forced to flee their homes during the war.
His family history was marked by the tragedy of escaping a pogrom.

vocab.word: at the turn of the century
vocab.ex: The city looked very different at the turn of the century.

vocab.mean: 下东区（纽约市一个历史悠久的社区）
vocab.ex: The Lower East Side has a rich history of immigrant culture.

gram.name: 一般过去时（用于历史叙事）
gram.pattern: A series of simple past tense verbs to recount past events.
gram.function: 通过使用一系列简单明了的过去时动词（'fled', 'ended up', 'met', 'got married', 'moved', 'had'），作者以一种清晰、线性的方式快速地叙述了家族的历史背景。

example.en: She graduated, found a job, and moved to a new city.
example.cn: 她毕业了，找到了一份工作，然后搬到了一个新的城市。

gram.constraints: 是讲述过去故事最基本和最常见的时态。

paras.en: Mom's side of the family is from Brazil. Except for her mother, my beautiful Grans, and her dad, Agosto, who died before I was born, the rest of Mom's family—all her glamorous aunts, uncles, and cousins—still live in Alto Leblon, a ritzy suburb south of Rio. Grans and Agosto moved to Boston in the early sixties, and had Mom and Aunt Kate, who's married to Uncle Porter.
paras.cn: 妈妈那边的家人来自巴西。除了她的母亲，我美丽的奶奶，和她的父亲，在我出生前就去世的奥古斯托，妈妈家其余的亲戚——她所有光彩照人的阿姨、叔叔和堂表亲——仍然住在里约南部的豪华郊区阿尔托莱布隆。奶奶和奥古斯托在六十年代初搬到了波士顿，生了妈妈和凯特阿姨，后者嫁给了波特叔叔。

vocab.ex: The room was empty except for a single chair in the corner.

vocab.mean: 富有魅力的；光彩照人的
vocab.ex: She led a glamorous life as a Hollywood movie star.
They stayed at a ritzy hotel with a rooftop pool.
Many families choose to live in the suburbs for more space.

gram.name: 破折号（用于引出同位语列表）
gram.pattern: Noun Phrase — Appositive List —
gram.function: 使用一对破折号来插入一个同位语短语或列表，对前面的名词进行补充说明。'...the rest of Mom's family—all her glamorous aunts, uncles, and cousins—still live...' 中，破折号之间的部分详细说明了“其余家人”具体包括谁。

example.en: My favorite snacks—chips, chocolate, and ice cream—are all unhealthy.
example.cn: 我最喜欢的零食——薯片、巧克力和冰淇淋——都不健康。

gram.constraints: 破折号比逗号更具强调意味。

paras.en: Mom and Dad met at Brown University and have been together ever since. Isabel and Nate: like two peas in a pod. They moved to New York right after college, had me a few years later, then moved to a brick townhouse in North River Heights, the hippie-stroller capital of upper upper Manhattan, when I was about a year old.
paras.cn: 妈妈和爸爸在布朗大学相遇，从那时起就一直在一起。伊莎贝尔和内特：就像一个豆荚里的两颗豌豆。他们大学一毕业就搬到了纽约，几年后生了我，然后在我大约一岁的时候，搬到了北河高地的一栋砖砌联排别墅，那是上上曼哈顿区的嬉皮士-婴儿车之都。

vocab.ex: They became best friends in first grade and have been inseparable ever since.

vocab.word: like two peas in a pod
vocab.ex: The twin sisters are like two peas in a pod; they do everything together.
They bought a beautiful brick townhouse in a quiet neighborhood.

vocab.mean: 嬉皮士-婴儿车之都（自创词，形容某地区年轻、自由派家庭聚集）
vocab.ex: The neighborhood, with its many parks and cafes, became known as the city's stroller capital.

gram.name: 同位语短语（用于描述）
gram.pattern: Noun, + Noun Phrase.
gram.function: 用于对前面的名词进行补充说明或提供一个生动的别称。'...North River Heights, the hippie-stroller capital of upper upper Manhattan...' 中，后面的名词短语为“北河高地”这个地名提供了一个充满文化色彩和幽默感的定义。

example.en: We visited Paris, the city of light.
example.cn: 我们参观了巴黎，那座光明之城。

gram.constraints: 同位语与它所修饰的词在逻辑上指的是同一事物。

paras.en: Not one person in the exotic mix of my family gene pool has ever shown any obvious signs of having what August has. I've pored over grainy sepia pictures of long-dead relatives in babushkas; black-and-white snapshots of distant cousins in crisp white linen suits, soldiers in uniform, ladies with beehive hairdos; Polaroids of bell-bottomed teenagers and long-haired hippies, and not once have I been able to detect even the slightest trace of August's face in their faces. Not a one. But after August was born, my parents underwent genetic counseling. They were told that August had what seemed to be a "previously unknown type of mandibulofacial dysostosis caused by an autosomal recessive mutation in the TCOF1 gene, which is located on chromosome 5, complicated by a hemifacial microsomia characteristic of OAV spectrum." Sometimes these mutations occur during pregnancy. Sometimes they're inherited from one parent carrying the dominant gene. Sometimes they're caused by the interaction of many genes, possibly in combination with environmental factors. This is called multifactorial inheritance. In August's case, the doctors were able to identify one of the "single nucleotide deletion mutations" that made war on his face. The weird thing is, though you'd never know it from looking at them: both my parents carry that mutant gene.
paras.cn: 在我家族奇异混合的基因库中，没有一个人曾显示出任何拥有奥古斯特那种情况的明显迹象。我仔细研究过戴着头巾的早已逝去亲戚的颗粒状棕褐色照片；穿着挺括的白色亚麻西装的远房堂表亲、穿着制服的士兵、梳着蜂窝式发型的女士们的黑白快照；穿着喇叭裤的青少年和长发嬉皮士的宝丽来照片，我一次也没能在他们的脸上发现哪怕一丝一毫奥古斯特脸的痕迹。一个都没有。但在奥古斯特出生后，我的父母接受了基因咨询。他们被告知，奥古斯特患有的似乎是一种“以前未知的下颌面骨发育不全，由位于5号染色体上的TCOF1基因的常染色体隐性突变引起，并伴有OAV谱系的半面短小症特征”。有时这些突变发生在怀孕期间。有时它们是从携带显性基因的父母一方遗传的。有时它们是由许多基因的相互作用引起的，可能还结合了环境因素。这被称为多因素遗传。在奥古斯特的案例中，医生们能够识别出向他的脸“宣战”的其中一种“单核苷酸缺失突变”。但奇怪的是，尽管你从外表上永远看不出来：我的父母双方都携带那个突变基因。

vocab.ex: Immigration contributes to a more diverse national gene pool.
The detective pored over the evidence for hours.

vocab.mean: 棕褐色的（常用于形容老照片）
vocab.ex: She found a box of old sepia photographs in her grandmother's attic.

vocab.mean: （尤指东欧老年妇女戴的）头巾
vocab.ex: The old woman wore a traditional babushka to keep her head warm.
The beehive hairdo was a popular style in the 1960s.
The sensitive equipment can detect even the slightest change in temperature.
There was no trace of fear in her voice.
They underwent genetic counseling before deciding to have children.
A rare genetic mutation caused the disease.

gram.name: 抒情与技术语言的并置
gram.pattern: Poetic description followed by scientific jargon.
gram.function: 作者首先使用充满怀旧和诗意的语言描述对老照片的研究（'grainy sepia pictures', 'beehive hairdos'），然后突然切换到一段极其复杂、冷冰冰的科学术语（'mandibulofacial dysostosis'）。这种风格上的巨大反差，深刻地突显了家庭情感历史与冰冷科学诊断之间的鸿沟，强调了这种状况的“天外来客”般的性质。

example.en: She remembered the soft summer breeze on her skin. The official report called it 'a category four hurricane.'
example.cn: 她记得皮肤上柔软的夏日微风。官方报告称其为“四级飓风”。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过风格对比来产生强烈情感冲击的文学技巧。

paras.en: And I carry it, too.
paras.cn: 我也携带它。

vocab.ex: Even if you don't have the disease, you might still carry the gene for it.

gram.name: 简短结论句（用于戏剧效果）
gram.pattern: A short, declarative sentence following a long, complex one.
gram.function: 在一个充满了复杂科学术语和家庭历史的长段落之后，使用一个极其简短、平淡的陈述句作为独立的段落，可以创造出巨大的戏剧冲击力。这个句子的简洁性赋予了它千钧之重，将一个遥远的科学概念突然变成了与叙述者自身密切相关的、令人震惊的个人事实，形成了强烈的结尾效果。

example.en: He explained all the complex reasons why it couldn't be done. Then she did it.
example.cn: 他解释了所有做不成这件事的复杂原因。然后她做到了。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比句长来创造高潮和悬念的文学技巧。

paras.en: If I have children, there's a one-in-two chance that I will pass on the defective gene to them. That doesn't mean they'll look like August, but they'll carry the gene that got double-dosed in August and helped make him the way he is. If I marry someone who has the same defective gene, there's a one-in-two chance that our kids will carry the gene and look totally normal, a one-in-four chance that our kids will not carry the gene at all, and a one-in-four chance that our kids will look like August.
paras.cn: 如果我生孩子，有二分之一的机会我会把这个缺陷基因传给他们。那不意味着他们会长得像奥古斯特，但他们会携带那个在奥古斯特身上被“双倍剂量”并导致他成为现在这个样子的基因。如果我和一个有同样缺陷基因的人结婚，我们的孩子有二分之一的机会会携带这个基因但看起来完全正常，有四分之一的机会完全不携带这个基因，还有四分之一的机会会长得像奥古斯特。

vocab.ex: There's a one-in-two chance of rain tomorrow.
Parents can pass on certain genetic traits to their children.
The company had to recall the defective product.

vocab.mean: 双倍剂量的（此处为比喻用法）
vocab.ex: He felt double-dosed with bad luck after losing his wallet and keys on the same day.

gram.name: 第一条件句（用于描述概率）
gram.pattern: If + present simple, ... there's a [probability] that...
gram.function: 用于描述一个真实的、将来可能发生的情况及其科学上或统计上的概率结果。'If I have children, there's a one-in-two chance...' 就是一个典型的例子。

example.en: If you flip a coin, there's a one-in-two chance it will land on heads.
example.cn: 如果你抛硬币，它正面朝上的几率是二分之一。

gram.constraints: 是一种基于事实和概率的条件陈述。

paras.en: If August has children with someone who doesn't have a trace of the gene, there's a 100 percent probability that their kids will inherit the gene, but a zero percent chance that their kids will have a double dose of it, like August. Which means they'll carry the gene no matter what, but they could look totally normal. If he marries someone who has the gene, their kids will have the same odds as my kids. This only explains the part of August that's explainable. There's that other part of his genetic makeup that's not inherited but just incredibly bad luck.
paras.cn: 如果奥古斯特和一个不带一丝该基因的人有孩子，他们的孩子有百分之百的概率会遗传这个基因，但有百分之零的机会像奥古斯特一样得到“双倍剂量”。这意味着他们无论如何都会携带这个基因，但他们可能看起来完全正常。如果他和一个有这个基因的人结婚，他们的孩子将会有和我孩子一样的几率。这只解释了奥古斯特身上可以解释的那部分。他的基因构成中还有另一部分，不是遗传的，而只是极其糟糕的运气。

vocab.ex: The detective couldn't find a single trace of the thief.
The probability of winning the lottery is extremely low.
She inherited her blue eyes from her mother.
I'll support you, no matter what happens.
What are the odds of winning the game?
Everyone has a unique genetic makeup.

gram.name: Which means... (解释性从句)
gram.pattern: Statement. Which means + explanation.
gram.function: 用作一个独立的句子或从句的开头，用于解释或澄清前面陈述的含义或结果。'Which means they'll carry the gene no matter what...' 解释了前面概率陈述的实际后果。

example.en: The flight is cancelled. Which means we'll have to stay here another night.
example.cn: 航班取消了。这意味着我们得在这里再待一晚。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的、用于承上启下的非正式用法。

paras.en: Countless doctors have drawn little tic-tac-toe grids for my parents over the years to try to explain the genetic lottery to them. Geneticists use these Punnett squares to determine inheritance, recessive and dominant genes, probabilities and chance. But for all they know, there's more they don't know. They can try to forecast the odds, but they can't guarantee them. They use terms like "germline mosaicism," "chromosome rearrangement," or "delayed mutation" to explain why their science is not an exact science. I actually like how doctors talk. I like the sound of science. I like how words you don't understand explain things you can't understand. There are countless people under words like "germline mosaicism," "chromosome rearrangement," or "delayed mutation." Countless babies who'll never be born, like mine.
paras.cn: 多年来，无数的医生为我父母画了小小的井字格，试图向他们解释基因彩票。遗传学家用这些庞氏表来确定遗传、隐性和显性基因、概率和几率。但就他们所知而言，他们不知道的更多。他们可以尝试预测几率，但无法保证。他们使用像“种系嵌合现象”、“染色体重排”或“延迟突变”这样的术语来解释为什么他们的科学不是一门精确的科学。我其实喜欢医生说话的方式。我喜欢科学的声音。我喜欢那些你不懂的词语解释你无法理解的事情的方式。在像“种系嵌合现象”、“染色体重排”或“延迟突变”这样的词语之下，有无数的人。无数永远不会出生的婴儿，就像我的（孩子）一样。

vocab.ex: There are countless stars in the night sky.
The children were playing a game of tic-tac-toe on a piece of paper.

vocab.mean: 基因彩票（比喻基因组合的随机性）
vocab.ex: Having such a rare talent is like winning the genetic lottery.
We used a Punnett square in biology class to predict the offspring's traits.
The gene for blue eyes is recessive.
Brown eyes are a dominant genetic trait.
It's difficult to forecast the long-term effects of this decision.
I can't guarantee that you will get the job, but you have a good chance.
Psychology is not an exact science like mathematics.

gram.name: 寻求慰藉的悖论陈述
gram.pattern: [Something unknown] explains [something unknowable].
gram.function: 通过一个看似矛盾的陈述 'I like how words you don't understand explain things you can't understand'，叙述者表达了一种独特的心理慰藉方式。她从科学术语的复杂性和确定性中找到了秩序感，即使她不理解这些词语的具体含义，它们的存在本身就为无法理解的随机悲剧提供了一种“解释”的框架。这是一种深刻的哲学反思。

example.en: There is a strange freedom in knowing that you can't control everything.
example.cn: 在知晓你无法控制一切这件事中，有一种奇特的自由。

gram.constraints: 是一种表达复杂心理状态的高级修辞手法。

gram.name: 结论性片段（用于个人化）
gram.pattern: A final sentence fragment that connects the general to the specific.
gram.function: 在一段关于“无数人”的普遍性论述之后，以一个极度个人化、充满情感的句子片段 'like mine' 结尾，创造出巨大的情感冲击力。它将宏大的科学和哲学讨论瞬间拉回到叙述者个人的、未曾言说的悲伤和恐惧中，形成了一个令人心碎的结尾。

example.en: Many people have faced such tragedies. People like me.
example.cn: 许多人都曾面临这样的悲剧。像我这样的人。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过对比和个人化来产生强烈情感冲击的文学技巧。

paras.en: Miranda and Ella blasted off. They attached themselves to a new crowd destined for high school glory. After a week of painful lunches where all they would do was talk about people that didn't interest me, I decided to make a clean break for it. They asked no questions. I told no lies. We just went our separate ways.
paras.cn: 米兰达和埃拉一飞冲天了。她们加入了一个注定要在高中大放异彩的新圈子。在经历了一周痛苦的午餐——她们只会谈论一些我不感兴趣的人——之后，我决定和她们一刀两断。她们没有问任何问题。我没有说任何谎言。我们就这样分道扬镳了。

vocab.mean: （像火箭一样）一飞冲天；迅速离开
vocab.ex: As soon as the bell rang, the students blasted off from the classroom.
The new employee quickly attached himself to the most successful team.
From a young age, it was clear she was destined for greatness.
After the argument, he decided to make a clean break and never speak to her again.
After graduation, the best friends went their separate ways and moved to different cities.

gram.name: 并列短句（用于表达终结感）
gram.pattern: Short Sentence 1. Short Sentence 2. Short Sentence 3.
gram.function: 通过使用一系列简洁、有力的短句（'They asked no questions. I told no lies. We just went our separate ways.'），作者创造了一种冷静、决绝的基调，强调了友谊结束的干脆和双方的默契，没有戏剧性的冲突，只有平静的疏远。

example.en: He packed his bag. He left the key. He walked out the door.
example.cn: 他收拾好包。他留下了钥匙。他走出了门。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过句法简洁性来传达强烈情感或终结感的文学技巧。

paras.en: I didn't even mind after a while. I stopped going to lunch for about a week, though, to make the transition easier, to avoid the fake Oh, shoot, there's no room for you at the table, Olivia! It was easier just to go to the library and read. I finished War and Peace in October. It was amazing. People think it's such a hard read, but it's really just a soap opera with lots of characters, people falling in love, fighting for love, dying for love. I want to be in love like that someday. I want my husband to love me the way Prince Andrei loved Natasha.
paras.cn: 过了一段时间我甚至都不介意了。不过，我大约有一周没去吃午饭，为了让过渡更容易，为了避免那种虚假的“哦，天哪，奥利维亚，桌子没你的位置了！”。去图书馆看书反而更容易。我在十月份读完了《战争与和平》。它太棒了。人们认为它是一本很难读的书，但它其实只是一部有很多角色的肥皂剧，人们坠入爱河，为爱而战，为爱而死。我希望有一天也能那样去爱。我希望我的丈夫能像安德烈公爵爱娜塔莎那样爱我。

vocab.ex: I don't mind the rain, but I hate the cold.
The transition from high school to college can be difficult for some students.
Oh, shoot, I forgot to bring my wallet.
That philosophy book was a really hard read.
She loves watching dramatic soap operas in the afternoon.

gram.name: 并列分词短语
gram.pattern: Noun + VERB-ing..., VERB-ing..., VERB-ing...
gram.function: 用于对前面的名词进行一系列并列的、动态的描述。'...a soap opera with lots of characters, people falling in love, fighting for love, dying for love' 中，后面三个分词短语生动地描绘了这些“角色”的行为。

example.en: It was a busy city, with cars honking, people shouting, and music playing.
example.cn: 那是一个繁忙的城市，汽车鸣笛，人们叫喊，音乐播放着。

gram.constraints: 是一种生动的描述性手法，可以使句子更具画面感。

paras.en: I ended up hanging out with a girl named Eleanor who I'd known from my days at PS 22, though we'd gone to different middle schools. Eleanor had always been a really smart girl —a little bit of a crybaby back then, but nice. I'd never realized how funny she was (not laugh-out-loud Daddy-funny, but full of great quips), and she never knew how lighthearted I could be. Eleanor, I guess, had always been under the impression that I was very serious. And, as it turns out, she'd never liked Miranda and Ella. She thought they were stuck-up.
paras.cn: 我最终和一位名叫埃莉诺的女孩一起玩，我从22号公立学校的日子就认识她了，尽管我们上了不同的中学。埃莉诺一直是一个非常聪明的女孩——那时有点爱哭，但人很好。我从未意识到她有多风趣（不是那种能让人哈哈大笑的爸爸式幽默，而是充满了精彩的俏皮话），而她也从未知道我能有多么轻松愉快。我猜，埃莉诺一直以为我非常严肃。而且，结果是，她从来就不喜欢米兰达和埃拉。她觉得她们很自以为是。

vocab.ex: He likes to hang out with his friends on the weekend.
Don't be such a crybaby over a little scratch.
He told a laugh-out-loud funny story about his vacation.
She was known for her witty quips and clever remarks.
The movie was a lighthearted comedy, perfect for a relaxing evening.
I was under the impression that the meeting was tomorrow.
I thought I had lost my wallet, but as it turns out, it was in my other coat.
He's so stuck-up, he won't even talk to people he doesn't know.

gram.name: 创造性复合形容词
gram.pattern: Phrase + Noun + adjective
gram.function: 通过将一个短语（'laugh-out-loud'）和一个名词（'Daddy'）与一个形容词（'funny'）用连字符连接，作者创造了一个非常具体、个人化的复合形容词 'laugh-out-loud Daddy-funny'。它不仅描述了幽默的类型，还将其与一个具体的参照物（爸爸）联系起来，使得描述非常独特和生动。

example.en: She gave me that classic 'I-told-you-so' look.
example.cn: 她给了我一个经典的“我早就告诉过你”的眼神。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的、非标准的构词法，用于增强描述效果。

paras.en: I gained entry through Eleanor to the smart-kids' table at lunch. It was a larger group than I'd been accustomed to hanging out with, and a more diverse crowd. It included Eleanor's boyfriend, Kevin, who would definitely become class president someday; a few techie guys; girls like Eleanor who were members of the yearbook committee and the debate club; and a quiet guy named Justin who had small round glasses and played the violin, and who I had an instant crush on.
paras.cn: 通过埃莉诺，我进入了午餐时的“聪明孩子”桌。这个团体比我习惯一起玩的要大，也更多元化。其中包括埃莉诺的男朋友凯文，他将来肯定会成为班长；几个技术宅男；像埃莉诺一样是年鉴委员会和辩论社成员的女孩们；还有一个名叫贾斯汀的安静男孩，他戴着小圆眼镜，会拉小提琴，我对他一见钟情。

vocab.mean: 获得进入（某个地方或团体）的权利
vocab.ex: He used a fake ID to gain entry to the club.
As a farmer, he was accustomed to waking up early.
The city has a very diverse population with people from all over the world.
If your computer breaks, you should ask a techie to help you fix it.
She joined the yearbook committee to help design the graduation book.
Being in the debate club helped him improve his public speaking skills.
The moment he saw her, he had an instant crush on her.

gram.name: 同位语与非限定性从句（用于描述）
gram.pattern: Noun, + who + ...
gram.function: 通过使用一系列非限定性定语从句和同位语，作者对新团体中的成员进行了详细的介绍。例如，'...Kevin, who would definitely become class president...' 和 '...Justin who had small round glasses...'，这些从句为人物增添了个性和背景信息。

example.en: The group included Sarah, who was the team captain, and Mark, an expert in history.
example.cn: 这个小组包括担任队长的莎拉，以及历史专家的马克。

gram.constraints: 非限定性从句通常用逗号隔开。

paras.en: When I'd see Miranda and Ella, who were now hanging out with the superpopular set, we'd say "Hey, what's up," and move on. Occasionally Miranda would ask me how August was doing, and then say "Tell him I say hello." This I never did, not to spite Miranda, but because August was in his own world these days. There were times, at home, that we never crossed paths.
paras.cn: 当我看到米兰达和埃拉——她们现在正和超级受欢迎的圈子一起玩——时，我们会说“嘿，你好吗”，然后就走开了。偶尔米兰达会问我奥古斯特怎么样了，然后说“告诉他我向他问好。” 这我从来没做过，不是为了气米兰达，而是因为这些天奥古斯特活在自己的世界里。有些时候，在家里，我们都碰不到面。

vocab.ex: She was the captain of the cheerleading squad and part of the super-popular crowd.
He's part of the artistic set and knows many painters and writers.
After a brief chat, we said goodbye and moved on.
We see each other occasionally, but not very often.
I didn't invite him, not to spite him, but simply because I forgot.
He's often in his own world, daydreaming and not paying attention.
We live in the same city, but our paths rarely cross.

gram.name: 宾语前置（用于强调）
gram.pattern: Object + Subject + Verb.
gram.function: 通过将宾语 'This'（指代 'Tell him I say hello' 这件事）置于句首，作者强调了叙述者没有做的“这件事”。这种倒装结构比常规语序 'I never did this' 更具强调意味和文学色彩。

example.en: That movie, I've seen it a dozen times.
example.cn: 那部电影，我看过十几次了。

gram.constraints: 是一种在口语和书面语中都存在的强调手法。

paras.en: Grans had died the night before Halloween. Since then, even though it's been four years, this has always been a sad time of year for me. For Mom, too, though she doesn't always say it. Instead, she immerses herself in getting August's costume ready, since we all know Halloween is his favorite time of year.
paras.cn: 奶奶是在万圣节前夜去世的。从那时起，尽管已经四年了，每年的这个时候对我来说总是很悲伤。对妈妈也是，虽然她不总说出来。相反，她会沉浸在为奥古斯特准备戏服中，因为我们都知道万圣节是他一年中最喜欢的日子。

vocab.ex: He moved away in 2010, and I haven't seen him since then.
To learn the language faster, she decided to immerse herself in the local culture.
I need to get my presentation ready for the meeting tomorrow.

gram.name: 让步与对比
gram.pattern: Statement of fact, though [concession]. Instead, [contrasting action].
gram.function: 通过使用 'though' 和 'instead'，作者建立了一个关于如何应对悲伤的对比。妈妈虽然也感到悲伤（'though she doesn't always say it'），但她选择的应对方式是“沉浸”在为奥古斯特准备戏服中，而不是直接表达悲伤。

example.en: He was very tired, though he didn't admit it. Instead, he just kept on working.
example.cn: 他非常累，尽管他不承认。相反，他只是继续工作。

gram.constraints: 是一种展示复杂情感和行为的有效结构。

paras.en: This year was no different. August really wanted to be a Star Wars character called Boba Fett, so Mom looked for a Boba Fett costume in August's size, which, strangely enough, was out of stock everywhere. She went to every online store, found a few on eBay that were going for an outrageous amount, and finally ended up buying a Jango Fett costume that she then converted into a Boba Fett costume by painting it green. I would say, in all, she must have spent two weeks working on the stupid costume. And no, I won't mention the fact that Mom has never made any of my costumes, because it really has no bearing on anything at all.
paras.cn: 今年也没什么不同。奥古斯特真的很想扮成一个叫波巴·费特的星球大战角色，所以妈妈找遍了奥古斯特尺码的波巴·费特戏服，但说也奇怪，到处都缺货。她逛了每一家网店，在eBay上找到了几件，但价格高得离谱，最后她买了一套詹戈·费特的戏服，然后把它漆成绿色，改造成了波巴·费特的戏服。总而言之，我得说，她肯定花了两个星期做那件傻傻的戏服。而且不，我不会提妈妈从来没给我做过任何戏服这件事，因为它真的和任何事情都毫无关系。

vocab.ex: I thought I had lost my keys, but strangely enough, I found them in the refrigerator.
The popular new video game was out of stock everywhere.
That rare comic book is going for a thousand dollars online.
The price they're asking for that old car is outrageous.
They decided to convert the old barn into a modern house.
In all, there were fifty people at the party.
Your personal feelings have no bearing on this legal decision.

gram.name: 假意否认法（Paralipsis/Apophasis）
gram.pattern: I won't mention [the thing being mentioned].
gram.function: 一种修辞手法，说话者通过声称自己“不会提及”某事，来巧妙地将听众的注意力引向这件事。'And no, I won't mention the fact that Mom has never made any of my costumes...' 恰恰就是为了强调“妈妈从未给我做过戏服”这一事实，并流露出叙述者内心的委屈和嫉妒。

example.en: I'm not going to talk about his terrible haircut, because that would be rude.
example.cn: 我不会谈论他那糟糕的发型，因为那会很无礼。

gram.constraints: 是一种带有讽刺或强调意味的高级修辞技巧。

paras.en: The morning of Halloween I woke up thinking about Grans, which made me really sad and weepy. Dad kept telling me to hurry up and get dressed, which just stressed me out even more, and suddenly I started crying. I just wanted to stay home. So Dad took August to school that morning and Mom said I could stay home, and the two of us cried together for a while. One thing I knew for sure: however much I missed Grans, Mom must have missed her more. All those times August was clinging to life after a surgery, all those rush trips to the ER: Grans had always been there for Mom. It felt good to cry with Mom. For both of us. At some point, Mom had the idea of our watching The Ghost and Mrs. Muir together, which was one of our all-time favorite black-and white movies. I agreed that that was a great idea. I think I probably would have used this weeping session as an opportunity to tell Mom everything that was going on at school with Miranda and Ella, but just as we were sitting down in front of the DVD player, the phone rang.
paras.cn: 万圣节的早上，我醒来时想着奶奶，这让我非常伤心和想哭。爸爸不停地催我快点穿好衣服，这让我压力更大，突然我就哭了起来。我只想待在家里。所以那天早上爸爸送奥古斯特去上学，妈妈说我可以待在家里，我们俩一起哭了一会儿。有一件事我非常确定：无论我多么想念奶奶，妈妈肯定比我更想念她。所有那些奥古斯特手术后挣扎求生的时刻，所有那些紧急赶往急诊室的行程：奶奶一直都在妈妈身边。和妈妈一起哭感觉很好。对我们俩都是。在某个时候，妈妈想到了我们一起看《孤寒寡女》的主意，那是我们一直以来最喜欢的黑白电影之一。我同意那是个很棒的主意。我想我本可能会利用这次哭泣的机会，告诉妈妈学校里关于米兰达和埃拉发生的一切，但就在我们刚在DVD播放机前坐下时，电话响了。

vocab.ex: The sad movie made her feel weepy.
Working long hours really starts to stress me out.
After the accident, the doctors said he was clinging to life.
He was rushed to the ER after he broke his arm.
Thank you for always being there for me when I need you.
That song is my all-time favorite.
After the sad news, the two friends had a long weeping session together.

gram.name: 混合条件句（未实现的过去机会）
gram.pattern: would have + pp ... but + simple past
gram.function: 用于描述一个在过去本可能发生但被另一个真实事件打断的机会。'I probably would have used this... as an opportunity... but... the phone rang' 清晰地展示了一个未实现的过去可能性（告诉妈妈一切）和打断它的真实事件（电话响了）。

example.en: I would have finished the race, but I twisted my ankle.
example.cn: 我本可以完成比赛的，但我的脚踝扭了。

gram.constraints: 是一种连接虚拟过去和真实过去的有效结构。

paras.en: It was the nurse from August's school calling to tell Mom that August had a stomach ache and should be picked up. So much for the old movies and the mother-daughter bonding.
paras.cn: 是奥古斯特学校的护士打来电话，告诉妈妈奥古斯特肚子疼，应该被接走。老电影和母女情深的美好时光就这样泡汤了。

vocab.ex: Eating too much candy gave him a stomach ache.
All children must be picked up by an adult after school.
It started raining. So much for our picnic in the park.
The camping trip was a great bonding experience for the family.

gram.name: 表达失望的习语
gram.pattern: So much for + Noun Phrase.
gram.function: 作为一个独立的句子，用于对一个刚刚破灭的计划或希望表示失望、无奈或讽刺。'So much for the old movies and the mother-daughter bonding' 简洁而有力地表达了叙述者对被打断的美好时光的惋惜之情。

example.en: The main speaker cancelled. So much for our big event.
example.cn: 主讲人取消了。我们的大活动算是泡汤了。

gram.constraints: 是一种非常地道的、表达负面结果的说法。

paras.en: Mom picked August up, and the moment he came home, he went straight to the bathroom and threw up. Then he went to his bed and pulled the covers over his head. Mom took his temperature, brought him some hot tea, and assumed the "August's mom" role again. "Via's mom," who had come out for a little while, was put away. I understood, though: August was in bad shape.
paras.cn: 妈妈接回了奥古斯特，他一到家，就径直去了卫生间吐了。然后他去了他的床，用被子蒙住了头。妈妈量了他的体温，给他端了些热茶，又重新承担起“奥古斯特的妈妈”这个角色。“维娅的妈妈”，那个出来了一小会儿的角色，被收起来了。不过我理解：奥古斯特的情况很糟。

vocab.ex: The crowd cheered the moment the team scored a goal.
He ate some bad seafood and felt like he was going to throw up.

vocab.word: pull the covers over one's head
vocab.ex: He was so sad, he just wanted to pull the covers over his head and disappear.
After her parents passed away, she had to assume the role of head of the family.
After the long journey, the old car was in bad shape.

gram.name: 角色拟人化
gram.pattern: Treating different parental roles as distinct entities.
gram.function: 通过将母亲的不同身份（'August's mom' 和 'Via's mom'）用引号框起来，并赋予它们动作（'assumed', 'had come out', 'was put away'），作者将这些“角色”拟人化，变成了可以被穿上和脱下的外衣。这种手法深刻地揭示了叙述者对自己在家中次要地位的认知，以及母亲身份在两个孩子之间切换时的无奈。

example.en: When he stepped into the office, 'the boss' took over, and 'the friend' disappeared.
example.cn: 当他走进办公室时，“老板”的角色接管了一切，“朋友”的角色消失了。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的、象征性的文学技巧。

paras.en: Neither one of us asked him why he had worn his Bleeding Scream costume to school instead of the Boba Fett costume Mom had made for him. If it annoyed Mom to see the costume she had worked on for two weeks tossed on the floor, unused, she didn't show it.
paras.cn: 我们俩谁也没问他为什么穿了流血鬼脸的戏服去学校，而不是妈妈为他做的那套波巴·费特的。如果看到她花了两周时间做的戏服被扔在地板上没被用过，让妈妈感到恼火的话，她也没有表现出来。

vocab.ex: I offered them coffee or tea, but neither one wanted anything.
He chose to walk instead of taking the bus.
She has been working on her new novel for over a year.
He tossed the empty bottle into the recycling bin.
The guest bedroom remained unused for months.

gram.name: 第一条件句（用于对过去推测）
gram.pattern: If + clause (simple past), + clause (simple past).
gram.function: 用于对过去可能发生但无法确定的情况进行推测。'If it annoyed Mom..., she didn't show it' 表达了叙述者对妈妈当时内心感受的一种猜测。虽然妈妈的行为是已知的（'she didn't show it'），但她内心的感受（'it annoyed Mom'）是不确定的。

example.en: If he was angry about my comment, he hid it well.
example.cn: 如果他当时对我的评论感到生气，他隐藏得很好。

gram.constraints: 是一种连接不确定前提和确定结果的结构。

paras.en: August said he wasn't feeling well enough to go trick-or-treating later in the afternoon, which was sad for him because I know how much he loved to trick-or-treat— especially after it got dark outside. Even though I was well beyond the trick-or-treating stage myself, I usually threw on some mask or other to accompany him up and down the blocks, watching him knocking on people's doors, giddy with excitement. I knew it was the one night a year when he could truly be like every other kid. No one knew he was different under the mask. To August, that must have felt absolutely amazing.
paras.cn: 奥古斯特说他下午感觉身体不适，不能去讨糖了，这对他来说很可悲，因为我知道他有多么喜欢讨糖——尤其是在天黑之后。尽管我自己早已过了讨糖的年纪，我通常还是会戴上某个面具，陪着他在街区里来回穿梭，看着他敲响人们的门，兴奋得晕乎乎的。我知道这是一年中唯一一个他能真正像其他每个孩子一样的夜晚。没人知道面具下的他是不同的。对奥古斯特来说，那感觉一定棒极了。

vocab.ex: After a week of rest, he finally felt well enough to go back to work.
The children can't wait to go trick-or-treating tonight.
His skills are well beyond what you'd expect from a beginner.
I was late, so I just threw on a T-shirt and jeans.
Minors must be accompanied by an adult to see this movie.
She felt giddy with excitement after winning the lottery.
Are you sure? Yes, absolutely.

gram.name: 强调性限定关系从句
gram.pattern: the one + noun + when/where/that...
gram.function: 通过在先行词前加上 'the one'，可以极大地强调其唯一性和特殊性。'the one night a year when he could truly be like every other kid' 将万圣节这一晚从所有其他夜晚中独立出来，突显了它对主角弟弟的非凡意义。

example.en: This is the one place in the world where I feel completely at peace.
example.cn: 这是世界上唯一一个能让我感到完全平静的地方。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的强调手法。

paras.en: At seven o'clock that night, I knocked on his door. "Hey," I said. "Hey," he said back. He wasn't using his PlayStation or reading a comic book. He was just lying in his bed looking at the ceiling. Daisy, as always, was next to him on the bed, her head draped over his legs. The Bleeding Scream costume was crumpled up on the floor next to the Boba Fett costume.
paras.cn: 那天晚上七点，我敲了他的门。“嘿，” 我说。“嘿，” 他回答。他没有在玩他的PlayStation，也没有在看漫画书。他只是躺在床上看着天花板。黛西，像往常一样，在他旁边的床上，头搭在他的腿上。那件流血鬼脸戏服皱巴巴地扔在地板上，旁边是波巴·费特的戏服。

vocab.ex: He has a large collection of vintage comic books.
He lay in bed staring at the ceiling, unable to sleep.
She was late for the meeting, as always.
A beautiful silk scarf was draped over the back of the chair.
He found a crumpled up piece of paper in his pocket.

gram.name: 过去进行时（用于设置场景）
gram.pattern: was/were + VERB-ing
gram.function: 用于描述在过去某个特定时间点正在进行的背景动作或状态。通过 'He wasn't using...', 'was just lying...' 等，作者创造了一个静态的、忧郁的“快照”，有效地为接下来的对话设置了伤感的基调。

example.en: When I walked in, music was playing softly and a fire was burning in the fireplace.
example.cn: 我走进去时，音乐正轻柔地播放着，壁炉里燃着火。

gram.constraints: 是叙事中设置背景的常用时态。

paras.en: "How's your stomach?" I said, sitting next to him on the bed. "I'm still nauseous." "You sure you're not up for the Halloween Parade?" "Positive." This surprised me. Usually August was such a trouper about his medical issues, whether it was skateboarding a few days after a surgery or sipping food through a straw when his mouth was practically bolted shut. This was a kid who's gotten more shots, taken more medicines, put up with more procedures by the age of ten than most people would have to put up with in ten lifetimes, and he was sidelined from a little nausea?
paras.cn: “你肚子怎么样了？” 我说，坐在他旁边的床上。“我还是想吐。” “你确定不去参加万圣节游行吗？” “确定。” 这让我很惊讶。通常奥古斯特对他的医疗问题都表现得非常坚强，无论是手术后几天就去玩滑板，还是在他嘴巴几乎被锁住时用吸管喝东西。这个孩子到十岁时，打过的针、吃过的药、忍受过的医疗程序比大多数人十辈子要忍受的都多，而他现在却因为一点点恶心就退出了？

vocab.ex: The smell of the old food made her feel nauseous.
Are you up for a long hike this weekend?
Are you sure? - Yes, I'm positive.

vocab.mean: 能吃苦耐劳的人；坚强的人
vocab.ex: Even though she was sick, she was a real trouper and finished the performance.
The heavy castle doors were bolted shut for the night.
I don't know how she puts up with his constant complaining.

vocab.mean: （因伤病等）退出比赛的；靠边站的
vocab.ex: An injury sidelined the star player for the rest of the season.

gram.name: 反问句（用于表达不相信）
gram.pattern: A question asked to make a point, not to get an answer.
gram.function: 说话者通过一个反问句来表达她对情况的震惊和怀疑。在列举了弟弟过往的坚强事迹后，用 '...and he was sidelined from a little nausea?' 来结尾，强烈地暗示了她认为真正的原因肯定比表面上的“恶心”要严重得多。

example.en: He complained about a 10-minute walk? Is he really that out of shape?
example.cn: 他抱怨走了10分钟的路？他真的那么虚弱吗？

gram.constraints: 其功能是表达观点或引发思考，而非获取信息。

paras.en: "You want to tell me what's up?" I said, sounding a bit like Mom. "No." "Is it school?" "Yes." "Teachers? Schoolwork? Friends?" He didn't answer. "Did someone say something?" I asked. "People always say something," he answered bitterly. I could tell he was close to crying.
paras.cn: “你想告诉我出什么事了吗？” 我说，听起来有点像妈妈。“不。” “是学校的事吗？” “是。” “老师？学业？朋友？” 他没有回答。“有人说了什么吗？” 我问。“人们总会说些什么的，” 他痛苦地回答。我看得出他快要哭了。

vocab.ex: You seem really quiet today. What's up?
She spoke bitterly about her past failures.
Her voice was trembling, and I could tell she was close to crying.

gram.name: 单词问答
gram.pattern: A series of single-word questions and answers.
gram.function: 通过使用一系列单词或极短的短语进行快速问答（'Is it school?' 'Yes.' 'Teachers? Schoolwork? Friends?'），作者营造了一种紧张、急促的对话节奏，生动地模仿了姐姐试图通过排除法快速找出问题所在的追问过程。

example.en: A: Hungry? B: Yes. A: Pizza? B: Perfect.
example.cn: A：饿吗？B：嗯。A：披萨？B：太好了。

gram.constraints: 是一种非常口语化的、高效的信息交换方式。

paras.en: And he told me what happened. He had overheard some very mean things some boys were saying about him. He didn't care about what the other boys had said, he expected that, but he was hurt that one of the boys was his "best friend" Jack Will. I remembered his mentioning Jack a couple of times over the past few months. I remembered Mom and Dad saying he seemed like a really nice kid, saying they were glad August had already made a friend like that.
paras.cn: 然后他告诉了我发生了什么。他无意中听到了一些男孩在说他一些非常刻薄的话。他不在乎其他男孩说了什么，他预料到了，但他受伤的是其中一个男孩是他的“好朋友”杰克·威尔。我记得过去几个月他提过几次杰克。我记得爸爸妈妈说他看起来像个非常好的孩子，说他们很高兴奥古斯特已经交了那样的朋友。

vocab.ex: I couldn't help but overhear their conversation.
It was mean of him to say such hurtful things.
I didn't expect to see you here!
She was deeply hurt by his cruel words.
Did he mention when he would be arriving?

gram.name: 所有格 + 动名词
gram.pattern: Possessive (his) + GERUND-ing
gram.function: 在动名词前使用所有格（如 my, your, his, John's），可以明确指出该动作的执行者。这是一种较为正式的书面语用法。'I remembered his mentioning Jack' 指的是“我记得他提及杰克这件事”。

example.en: I appreciate your helping me with this difficult task.
example.cn: 我很感激你帮我完成这项艰巨的任务。

variants: Object Pronoun + GERUND-ing (less formal, e.g., 'him mentioning')
gram.constraints: 在正式语境中，使用所有格更受青睐。

paras.en: "Sometimes kids are stupid," I said softly, holding his hand. "I'm sure he didn't mean it." "Then why would he say it? He's been pretending to be my friend all along. Tushman probably bribed him with good grades or something. I bet you he was like, hey, Jack, if you make friends with the freak, you don't have to take any tests this year." "You know that's not true. And don't call yourself a freak." "Whatever. I wish I'd never gone to school in the first place." "But I thought you were liking it." "I hate it!" He was angry all of a sudden, punching his pillow. "I hate it! I hate it! I hate it!" He was shrieking at the top of his lungs.
paras.cn: “有时候孩子们就是很蠢，” 我轻声说，握着他的手。“我敢肯定他不是故意的。” “那他为什么要说？他一直以来都在假装是我的朋友。塔什曼先生可能用好成绩之类的贿赂了他。我敢打赌他当时就说，嘿，杰克，如果你和那个怪物做朋友，你今年就不用参加任何考试了。” “你知道那不是真的。而且别叫自己怪物。” “随便啦。我真希望我当初根本就没去上学。” “但我以为你挺喜欢的。” “我恨它！” 他突然生气了，捶打着他的枕头。“我恨它！我恨它！我恨它！” 他声嘶力竭地尖叫着。

vocab.ex: I'm sorry, I didn't mean it when I said that.
The corrupt official was accused of accepting a bribe.
The bullies called him a freak just for having different interests.
I should never have trusted him in the first place.
She let out a shriek when she saw the spider.

vocab.word: at the top of one's lungs
vocab.ex: The fans were cheering for their team at the top of their lungs.

gram.name: 重复（用于情感爆发）
gram.pattern: Repeating a phrase to show intense emotion.
gram.function: 通过三次重复 'I hate it!'，并配合 'punching his pillow' 和 'shrieking' 的动作描述，作者生动地描绘了一场强烈的情感爆发，传达了主角在遭受背叛后极度的愤怒、伤害和绝望。

example.en: 'I can't believe it! I can't believe it!' she repeated, shaking her head.
example.cn: “我不敢相信！我不敢相信！” 她重复着，摇着头。

gram.constraints: 是一种表现强烈情感的有效叙事技巧。

paras.en: I didn't say anything. I didn't know what to say. He was hurt. He was mad. I let him have a few more minutes of his fury. Daisy started licking the tears off of his face. "Come on, Auggie," I said, patting his back gently. "Why don't you put on your Jango Fett costume and—" "It's a Boba Fett costume! Why does everyone mix that up?" "Boba Fett costume," I said, trying to stay calm. I put my arm around his shoulders. "Let's just go to the parade, okay?" "If I go to the parade, Mom will think I'm feeling better and make me go to school tomorrow." "Mom would never make you go to school," I answered. "Come on, Auggie. Let's just go. It'll be fun, I promise. And I'll let you have all my candy."
paras.cn: 我什么也没说。我不知道该说什么。他受伤了。他很生气。我让他又发泄了几分钟的怒火。黛西开始舔掉他脸上的眼泪。“好了，奥吉，” 我说，轻轻地拍着他的背。“你为什么不穿上你的詹戈·费特戏服然后——” “是波巴·费特的戏服！为什么每个人都搞混？” “波巴·费特的戏服，” 我说，努力保持冷静。我把胳膊搭在他的肩膀上。“我们就去游行吧，好吗？” “如果我去游行，妈妈会以为我好多了，然后明天让我去上学。” “妈妈绝不会强迫你去上学的，” 我回答。“来吧，奥吉。我们就去吧。会很好玩的，我保证。而且我会把我的糖果都给你。”

vocab.ex: He slammed the door in a fit of fury.
She patted the dog gently on its head.
People always mix up the twin brothers because they look so alike.
Even in an emergency, it's important to try to stay calm.

gram.name: 第一条件句（用于陈述后果）
gram.pattern: If + present simple, ... will + infinitive
gram.function: 用于陈述一个潜在的未来动作及其逻辑上或预期的后果。奥吉使用这个结构 'If I go to the parade, Mom will think I'm feeling better and make me go...' 来解释他为什么不想去游行的原因，展示了他的担忧和推理。

example.en: If you don't water the plants, they will die.
example.cn: 如果你不给植物浇水，它们就会死。

gram.constraints: 是表达因果关系的基本句型。

paras.en: He didn't argue. He got out of bed and slowly started pulling on his Boba Fett costume. I helped him adjust the straps and tighten the belt, and by the time he put his helmet on, I could tell he was feeling better.
paras.cn: 他没有争辩。他下了床，慢慢地开始穿上他的波巴·费特戏服。我帮他调整带子，系紧腰带，到他戴上头盔的时候，我看得出他感觉好多了。

vocab.ex: I don't want to argue with you about this.
He quickly pulled on his jacket and ran out the door.
You may need to adjust the straps on the backpack to make it comfortable.
You need to tighten the screws to make the shelf stable.
Always wear a helmet when you ride a bike.

gram.name: By the time... (与一般过去时连用)
gram.pattern: by the time + clause (simple past), + clause (simple past/past continuous)
gram.function: 用于表示在过去某个动作（'he put his helmet on'）发生时，另一个状态（'I could tell...'）已经存在或正在发生。它强调了一个时间节点和当时的状态。

example.en: By the time the police arrived, the thief was long gone.
example.cn: 等警察赶到时，小偷早已不见踪影了。

gram.constraints: 用于连接两个过去的事件，表明它们的时间关系。

paras.en: August played up the stomach ache the next day so he wouldn't have to go to school. I admit I felt a little bad for Mom, who was genuinely concerned that he had a stomach bug, but I had promised August I wouldn't tell her about the incident at school. By Sunday, he was still determined not to go back to school.
paras.cn: 第二天，奥古斯特夸大了肚子疼的病情，这样他就不用去上学了。我承认我有点为妈妈感到难过，她真诚地担心他得了肠胃炎，但我已经答应了奥古斯特，我不会告诉她学校里发生的事。到了周日，他仍然决心不再回学校。

vocab.mean: 夸大（疾病、问题的重要性）
vocab.ex: He's not really that sick; he's just playing it up to get sympathy.
Eating too much candy gave him a stomach ache.
I feel bad for him because he lost his job.
I am genuinely grateful for all your help.
A lot of students are absent today because a stomach bug is going around the school.
She was determined to finish the race, despite her injury.

gram.name: so (that) 目的状语从句
gram.pattern: Action + so (that) + purpose clause
gram.function: 用于解释一个动作的目的。'...played up the stomach ache so he wouldn't have to go to school' 解释了“夸大病情”背后的目的。

example.en: I studied hard so I could pass the exam.
example.cn: 我努力学习，以便能通过考试。

gram.constraints: 口语中 'that' 常常被省略。

paras.en: "What are you planning on telling Mom and Dad?" I asked him when he told me this. "They said I could quit whenever I wanted to." He said this while he was still focused on a comic book he was reading. "But you've never been the kind of kid who quits things," I said truthfully. "That's not like you." "I'm quitting." "You're going to have to tell Mom and Dad why," I pointed out, pulling the comic book out of his hands so he'd have to look up at me while we were talking. "Then Mom will call the school and everyone will know about it."
paras.cn: “你打算告诉爸爸妈妈什么？” 当他告诉我这个时，我问他。“他们说过我想退出随时都可以。” 他说这话时，仍然专注于他正在读的一本漫画书。“但你从来不是那种会放弃事情的孩子，” 我如实说。“那不像你。” “我要退出了。” “你得告诉爸爸妈妈为什么，” 我指出，从他手里抽走漫画书，这样我们说话时他就得抬头看我。“然后妈妈就会给学校打电话，所有人就都知道了。”

vocab.ex: What are you planning on doing this weekend?
He decided to quit his job and travel the world.
Please answer the questions truthfully.
You're usually so cheerful. Being this quiet is not like you.
He was quick to point out my mistakes.

gram.name: while 引导的对比动作
gram.pattern: Main action + while + contrasting background action
gram.function: 用于连接两个同时发生但形成对比的动作，强调一方的专注与另一方的漠不关心。'He said this while he was still focused on a comic book...' 突显了弟弟在谈论重大决定时的漫不经心，与姐姐的关切形成对比。

example.en: She was trying to have a serious conversation while he was just scrolling through his phone.
example.cn: 她试图进行严肃的谈话，而他只是在刷手机。

gram.constraints: 是一种展示人物态度差异的有效手法。

paras.en: "Will Jack get in trouble?" "I would think so." "Good." I have to admit, August was surprising me more and more. He pulled another comic book off his shelf and started leafing through it. "Auggie," I said. "Are you really going to let a couple of stupid kids keep you from going back to school? I know you've been enjoying it. Don't give them that power over you. Don't give them the satisfaction."
paras.cn: “杰克会惹上麻烦吗？” “我想会的。” “好。” 我得承认，奥古斯特越来越让我惊讶了。他又从书架上抽出一本漫画书，开始翻阅。“奥吉，” 我说。“你真的要让几个蠢孩子阻止你回学校吗？我知道你一直很享受。别给他们那种能控制你的权力。别让他们得逞。”

vocab.ex: He got in trouble at school for talking during class.
A: Is this the right way? B: I would think so.
It's getting more and more difficult to find a parking spot.
She was leafing through a magazine while waiting for her appointment.
The bad weather kept us from going to the beach.
He smiled with satisfaction after finishing the difficult task.

gram.name: 否定祈使句（用于劝告）
gram.pattern: Don't + infinitive
gram.function: 用于给出强烈的建议或劝告，告诉某人不要做某事。通过重复 'Don't give them...'，姐姐有力地试图劝说弟弟不要让别人的行为影响自己的决定。

example.en: Don't let their negative comments affect you.
example.cn: 别让他们的负面评论影响你。

gram.constraints: 后面必须跟动词原形。

paras.en: "They have no idea I even heard them," he explained. "No, I know, but . . ." "Via, it's okay. I know what I'm doing. I've made up my mind." "But this is crazy, Auggie!" I said emphatically, pulling the new comic book away from him, too. "You have to go back to school. Everyone hates school sometimes. I hate school sometimes. That's just life, Auggie. You want to be treated normally, right? This is normal! We all have to go to school sometimes despite the fact that we have bad days, okay?"
paras.cn: “他们根本不知道我听到了，” 他解释说。“不，我知道，但是……” “维娅，没关系。我知道我在做什么。我已经下定决心了。” “但这太疯狂了，奥吉！” 我强调地说，也把新的漫画书从他手中抽走。“你必须回学校去。每个人有时都会讨厌学校。我有时也讨厌学校。生活就是这样，奥吉。你想被正常对待，对吧？这就是正常的！我们都得去上学，有时尽管会遇到糟糕的日子，好吗？”

vocab.ex: I have no idea where I left my keys.
Have you made up your mind about which university to attend?
She emphatically denied any involvement in the scandal.
Sometimes things don't go as planned. That's just life.
He went for a run despite the fact that it was raining.

gram.name: 平行结构（用于说明普遍经验）
gram.pattern: Everyone... I...
gram.function: 通过将一个普遍的陈述（'Everyone hates school sometimes'）与一个个人化的陈述（'I hate school sometimes'）并列，姐姐试图建立一种共通感，让她弟弟明白他的经历（讨厌学校）是一种“正常”的、普遍的体验，以此来劝说他。

example.en: Everyone feels nervous before a big test. I feel nervous too.
example.cn: 每个人在重要考试前都会感到紧张。我也感到紧张。

gram.constraints: 是一种建立同理心和说服力的有效修辞手法。

paras.en: "Do people go out of their way to avoid touching you, Via?" he answered, which left me momentarily without an answer. "Yeah, right. That's what I thought. So don't compare your bad days at school to mine, okay?" "Okay, that's fair," I said. "But it's not a contest about whose days suck the most, Auggie. The point is we all have to put up with the bad days. Now, unless you want to be treated like a baby the rest of your life, or like a kid with special needs, you just have to suck it up and go."
paras.cn: “人们会特意避开不碰你吗，维娅？” 他回答，这让我一时语塞。“是啊，没错。我就知道是这样。所以别拿你在学校糟糕的日子和我的比，好吗？” “好吧，这很公平，” 我说。“但这又不是一场比谁的日子最糟糕的比赛，奥吉。关键是我们都得忍受糟糕的日子。现在，除非你想一辈子被当成婴儿对待，或者像个有特殊需求的孩子，你就得硬着头皮去。”

vocab.ex: She always goes out of her way to help new employees feel welcome.
He was momentarily stunned by the bright flash of light.
You want half the pizza? Okay, that's fair.
This movie really sucks.
I don't know how she puts up with his constant complaining.
The school has excellent resources for children with special needs.
I know you're tired, but we have to finish this hike. Just suck it up.

gram.name: Unless (引导否定条件)
gram.pattern: Unless + clause, + main clause
gram.function: 意为“除非”，用于引出一个唯一的例外情况。主句陈述一个必须做的事情，而 'unless' 从句则提供了唯一可以不做这件事的条件。'unless you want to be treated like a baby..., you just have to suck it up and go' 是一种非常强硬的劝说方式。

example.en: You are not allowed to go to the party unless you finish your homework.
example.cn: 除非你完成作业，否则不准去参加派对。

gram.constraints: 是一种常见的表达否定条件的连词。

paras.en: He didn't say anything, but I think that last bit was getting to him. "You don't have to say a word to those kids," I continued. "August, actually, it's so cool that you know what they said, but they don't know you know what they said, you know?"
paras.cn: 他什么也没说，但我想最后那一点触动了他。“你一个字都不用对那些孩子说，” 我继续说。“奥古斯特，其实，你知道他们说了什么，但他们不知道你知道他们说了什么，这太酷了，你知道吗？”

vocab.mean: 影响到某人；使某人烦恼/动摇
vocab.ex: Don't let his negative comments get to you.
Promise me you won't say a word about this to anyone.

gram.name: 复杂名词性从句（用于解释优势）
gram.pattern: ...that you know [X], but they don't know you know [X].
gram.function: 这是一个复杂的、层层嵌套的名词性从句结构，用于解释一种信息不对称所带来的优势。叙述者通过这种有些绕口的表达方式，试图向弟弟展示他所处位置的独特力量：他掌握了信息，而对方却不知道他掌握了信息。这种语言游戏本身也试图将一个痛苦的局面重新定义为一个“酷”的局面。

example.en: The best part is that I know he's lying, but he doesn't know I know he's lying.
example.cn: 最棒的部分是，我知道他在撒谎，但他不知道我知道他在撒谎。

gram.constraints: 是一种通过语言复杂性来表达复杂思想的技巧。

paras.en: "What the heck?" "You know what I mean. You don't have to talk to them ever again, if you don't want. And they'll never know why. See? Or you can pretend to be friends with them, but deep down inside you know you're not." "Is that how you are with Miranda?" he asked.
paras.cn: “什么鬼？” “你懂我的意思。如果你不想，你可以再也不和他们说话。而且他们永远不会知道为什么。明白吗？或者你可以假装和他们是朋友，但在内心深处你知道你不是。” “你和米兰达就是那样的吗？” 他问。

vocab.ex: What the heck are you doing in my room?
After that terrible experience, I'm never going there ever again.
The children liked to pretend to be superheroes.
He acts tough, but deep down inside, he's a very sensitive person.

gram.name: 附加问句 (See?)
gram.pattern: Statement. See?
gram.function: 在陈述一个观点或解释之后，附加一个简短的 'See?'，用于寻求对方的理解和认同，意为“明白吗？”或“你看是不是这样？”。

example.en: If you press this button, the light turns on. See?
example.cn: 如果你按这个按钮，灯就会亮。明白吗？

gram.constraints: 是一种非常口语化的用法。

paras.en: "No," I answered quickly, defensively. "I never faked my feelings with Miranda." "So why are you saying I should?" "I'm not! I'm just saying you shouldn't let those little jerks get to you, that's all." "Like Miranda got to you." "Why do you keep bringing Miranda up?" I yelled impatiently. "I'm trying to talk to you about your friends. Please keep mine out of it." "You're not even friends with her anymore."
paras.cn: “不，” 我迅速地、防卫性地回答。“我对米兰达从来没有假装过我的感情。” “那你为什么说我应该那样做？” “我没有！我只是说你不应该让那些小混蛋影响到你，仅此而已。” “就像米兰达影响到你一样。” “你为什么老提米兰达？” 我不耐烦地喊道。“我正在试着和你谈论你的朋友。请把我的朋友排除在外。” “你甚至已经不再和她是朋友了。”

vocab.ex: When she was criticized, she reacted defensively.
You can't fake sincerity; people will know.
Don't be such a jerk to your little sister.
Don't let his negative comments get to you.
I hate to bring this up, but you still owe me money.
This is a private conversation; please keep your opinions out of it.

gram.name: 使用 'Like' 进行对抗性比较
gram.pattern: Like + Noun + Verb + you.
gram.function: 在这里，奥吉使用 'Like...' 结构不是为了简单的比喻，而是一种对抗性的反驳。他将姐姐刚才给出的建议（'don't let them get to you'）与他观察到的姐姐自己的行为（'Miranda got to you'）直接联系起来，揭示了姐姐言行不一的伪善之处。这是一种非常直接和有力的反击方式。

example.en: You tell me to be on time? Like you weren't an hour late yesterday.
example.cn: 你让我准时？说得好像你昨天没迟到一小时似的。

gram.constraints: 是一种在争论中常见的、带有讽刺意味的口语用法。

paras.en: "What does that have to do with what we're talking about?" The way August was looking at me reminded me of a doll's face. He was just staring at me blankly with his half-closed doll eyes. "She called the other day," he said finally. "What?" I was stunned. "And you didn't tell me?" "She wasn't calling you," he answered, pulling both comic books out of my hands. "She was calling me. Just to say hi. To see how I was doing. She didn't even know I was going to a real school now. I can't believe you hadn't even told her. She said the two of you don't hang out as much anymore, but she wanted me to know she'd always love me like a big sister."
paras.cn: “那和我们正在谈论的有什么关系？” 奥古斯特看我的样子让我想起了一张洋娃娃的脸。他只是用他半闭的娃娃眼茫然地盯着我。“她前几天打来电话了，” 他最后说。“什么？” 我惊呆了。“你没告诉我？” “她不是打给你的，” 他回答，从我手中抽走两本漫画书。“她是打给我的。只是为了问个好。看看我怎么样了。她甚至不知道我现在上真正的学校了。我真不敢相信你居然都没告诉她。她说你们俩不怎么一起玩了，但她想让我知道她会永远像大姐姐一样爱我。”

vocab.ex: What does your personal life have to do with your job performance?
He just stared blankly at the wall, lost in thought.
He listened with his eyes half-closed, looking sleepy.
I saw him at the supermarket the other day.
She was stunned to hear that she had won the award.

gram.name: 对比强调（She wasn't calling... She was calling...）
gram.function: 通过使用两个结构相同但意义相反的进行时句子 'She wasn't calling you... She was calling me'，奥吉创造了一个强烈的对比，不仅纠正了姐姐的误解，更强调了电话的真正对象是他自己，从而揭示了一个令姐姐震惊的事实。

example.en: He wasn't looking at the painting; he was looking at the artist.
example.cn: 他不是在看画；他是在看那位艺术家。

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中进行澄清和强调的有效方式。

paras.en: Double-stunned. Stung. Flabbergasted. No words formed in my mouth. "Why didn't you tell me?" I said, finally. "I don't know." He shrugged, opening the first comic book again. "Well, I'm telling Mom and Dad about Jack Will if you stop going to school," I answered. "Tushman will probably call you into school and make Jack and those other kids apologize to you in front of everyone, and everyone will treat you like a kid who should be going to a school for kids with special needs. Is that what you want? Because that's what's going to happen. Otherwise, just go back to school and act like nothing happened. Or if you want to confront Jack about it, fine. But either way, if you—"
paras.cn: 双重震惊。被刺痛了。目瞪口呆。我嘴里一个字也说不出来。“你为什么没告诉我？” 我最后说。“我不知道。” 他耸耸肩，又打开了第一本漫画书。“好吧，如果你不去上学，我就告诉爸爸妈妈关于杰克·威尔的事，” 我回答。“塔什曼先生可能会把你叫到学校，让杰克和那些其他孩子当着所有人的面给你道歉，然后每个人都会把你当作一个应该去特殊需要儿童学校的孩子。那是你想要的吗？因为那将会发生。否则，就回学校去，装作什么都没发生。或者如果你想就此事和杰克对质，也行。但无论哪种方式，如果你——”

vocab.ex: She was double-stunned, first by the news and then by his reaction to it.
She felt stung by his harsh criticism.
I was flabbergasted when I heard he had won the lottery.
You need to apologize to your sister for breaking her toy.
She decided to confront her coworker about the rumors.
We can go to the movies or stay home. Either way, I'm happy.

gram.name: 连接词省略与片段（用于表达震惊）
gram.pattern: A series of words or short phrases without conjunctions.
gram.function: 通过使用一系列没有连接词的单词片段（'Double-stunned. Stung. Flabbergasted.'），作者模仿了人在极度震惊时思绪断裂、无法形成完整句子的状态。这种连接词省略法（Asyndeton）创造了一种急促、有力的节奏，生动地传达了叙述者当时的情感冲击。

example.en: Panic. Fear. Confusion. He didn't know which way to run.
example.cn: 恐慌。恐惧。困惑。他不知道该往哪个方向跑。

gram.constraints: 是一种高级的文学技巧，用于创造强烈的节奏和情感效果。

paras.en: "Fine. Fine. Fine," he interrupted. "What?" "Fine! I'll go!" he yelled, not loudly. "Just stop talking about it already. Can I please read my book now?" "Fine!" I answered. Turning to leave his room, I thought of something. "Did Miranda say anything else about me?" He looked up from the comic book and looked right into my eyes. "She said to tell you she misses you. Quote unquote." I nodded. "Thanks," I said casually, too embarrassed to let him see how happy that made me feel.
paras.cn: “行。行。行，” 他打断道。“什么？” “行！我去！” 他不大声地喊道。“别再谈这个了。我现在能看我的书了吗？” “行！” 我回答。转身离开他的房间时，我想起了一件事。“米兰达还说了关于我的其他事吗？” 他从漫画书上抬起头，直视我的眼睛。“她说让我告诉你她想你。原话如此。” 我点了点头。“谢了，” 我随口说，太不好意思让他看到那让我有多开心。

vocab.ex: It's considered rude to interrupt someone when they are speaking.

vocab.mean: （用于句末，表示不耐烦）快点吧
vocab.ex: Hurry up and finish your dinner already!
He casually mentioned that he was moving to another country.
She felt embarrassed when she forgot her lines on stage.

vocab.mean: 原话如此（用于口头引用或强调）
vocab.ex: He said he was, quote unquote, 'too busy' to help.
vocab.ex_cn: 他说他，原话如此，“太忙了”没法帮忙。

gram.name: 重复（用于让步）
gram.pattern: Repeating a word to signal agreement or surrender.
gram.function: 通过重复三次 'Fine'，奥吉表达了一种不情愿的、带有投降意味的同意。这种重复不仅仅是简单的“同意”，它传达了他被打断、被迫做出决定的烦躁和无奈。

example.en: A: Are you going to clean your room? B: Okay, okay, okay, I'll do it!
example.cn: A：你要去打扫你的房间吗？B：好了，好了，好了，我去做！

gram.constraints: 是一种在对话中表达复杂情绪（如不耐烦的同意）的常见方式。
